translation.title: The Interior as Impermanent in the Three Times

next.name: The Interior as Suffering in the Three Times

segments.en: 7. The Interior as Impermanent in the Three Times
“Mendicants, the eye of the past and future is impermanent,

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako atītasmiṃ cakkhusmiṃ anapekkho hoti;
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the eye of the past,
they don’t look forward to enjoying the eye in the future,

segments.pli: paccuppannassa cakkhussa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the eye in the present.

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako atītāya jivhāya anapekkho hoti;
paccuppannāya jivhāya nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.

segments.en: mind of the past and future is impermanent,

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako atītasmiṃ manasmiṃ anapekkho hoti;
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the mind of the past,
they don’t look forward to enjoying the mind in the future,

segments.pli: paccuppannassa manassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hotī”ti.
segments.en: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the mind in the present.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, the eye of the past and future is…

suttaplex.blurb: In the past, future, and present, the six interior sense fields are impermanent, suffering, and not-self. When a noble disciple truly sees them like this, they become disillusioned and liberated.
